|  [charCode](./text-canvas.charcode.md) |  |
|  [circle](./text-canvas.circle.md) | Draws a circle (filled or outline) at given center position and radius and taking the current clip rect and format into account. If <code>char</code> is not given, uses current style's <code>dot</code> char. |
|  [clear](./text-canvas.clear.md) | Clears/fills the canvas' current clip rect with given char (default: 0x20 / space). If <code>reset</code> is true, first resets all internal state (clipping, format, style), so that entire canvas will be cleared. |

|  [fillRect](./text-canvas.fillrect.md) | Fills given rect with char, taking currect clip rect and format into account. |
|  [FMT\_ANSI16](./text-canvas.fmt_ansi16.md) | String format preset, translating canvas format info to ANSI 4bit control sequences.<!-- -->https://stackoverflow.com/a/33206814/294515 |
|  [FMT\_HTML\_INLINE\_CSS](./text-canvas.fmt_html_inline_css.md) | Preset HTML string formatter, generating <code>&lt;span&gt;</code> elements with inline CSS. |
|  [FMT\_HTML\_TACHYONS](./text-canvas.fmt_html_tachyons.md) | Preset HTML formatter, generating <code>&lt;span&gt;</code> elements with Tachyons CSS classes. |
|  [formatHtml](./text-canvas.formathtml.md) | Constructs an HTML formatter using given config options. |
|  [getAt](./text-canvas.getat.md) |  |
|  [hline](./text-canvas.hline.md) | Draws horizontal line from <code>x</code>,<code>y</code>, taking the current clip rect, format and style into account. The optional <code>s</code>, <code>e</code> (line endings) and <code>m</code> (line middle) chars can be used to override the currently active style. |
|  [image](./text-canvas.image.md) |  |
|  [initTable](./text-canvas.inittable.md) |  |
|  [intersectRect](./text-canvas.intersectrect.md) |  |
|  [intersectRectCircle](./text-canvas.intersectrectcircle.md) |  |
|  [line](./text-canvas.line.md) | Draws a line between <code>ax</code>,<code>ay</code> and <code>bx</code>,<code>by</code>, using <code>char</code> and taking the current clip rect and format into account. If <code>char</code> is not given, uses current style's <code>dot</code> char. |
|  [NONE](./text-canvas.none.md) |  |
|  [resize](./text-canvas.resize.md) |  |
|  [scrollV](./text-canvas.scrollv.md) | Scrolls canvas vertically by <code>dy</code> lines. If <code>dy &gt; 0</code> content moves upward, if <code>dy &lt; 0</code> downward. The new empty space will be filled with <code>clear</code> char (default: <code> </code>). |

|  [strokeRect](./text-canvas.strokerect.md) | Draws an outline of given rect, taking the current clip rect, format and style into account. |

|  [tableCanvas](./text-canvas.tablecanvas.md) | Initializes table with given options and contents. Then creates auto-sized canvas for it, renders table and returns canvas. |
|  [textBox](./text-canvas.textbox.md) |  |
|  [textColumn](./text-canvas.textcolumn.md) | Writes multiline string at position <code>x</code>,<code>y</code> and using column <code>width</code>, also taking the current clip rect and format into account. Applies word wrapping. |
|  [textLine](./text-canvas.textline.md) | Writes given string at position <code>x</code>,<code>y</code>, taking the current clip rect and format into account. The string MUST not include linebreaks or other control chars. |
|  [textLines](./text-canvas.textlines.md) |  |
|  [toString](./text-canvas.tostring.md) | Returns string representation of canvas, optionally using given string formatter. If none is given, returns plain string representation, ignoring any character format data. |
|  [UNDERLINE](./text-canvas.underline.md) |  |
|  [vline](./text-canvas.vline.md) | Draws a vertical line from <code>x</code>,<code>y</code>, taking the current clip rect, format and style into account. The optional <code>s</code>, <code>e</code> (line endings) and <code>m</code> (line middle) chars can be used to override the currently active style. |
